entry.title: Re: Approval Strategy for Sales Order
entry.content:
Hi,

You could implement BAdI to do your custom logic. 

1. You need to create 2 Approval request reason and create 2 Workflow in Fiori App Manage Sales Document Workflows with corresponding condition. Let say LE09 and GT09.

2. Implement your BAdI SD_APM_SET_APPROVAL_REASON to change the Value salesdocapprovalreason to LE09 or GT09 based on your logic.

You might use CDS view I_SALESORDERITEMPRICINGELEMENT or I_SALESORDERPRICINGELEMENT or extend I_SALESORDER (if needed) to get all value you need.

Thanks,

Dan

entry.title: Re: Export Software Collection in a Public Cloud environm...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Currently, the systems are upgraded to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2602.

Please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue:

When encountering an ‚ÄòExport Failed‚Äô error without detailed information, especially after a system upgrade, there are several steps you can take to troubleshoot and resolve the issue:

  1. Check for System Locks:

    • Ensure that there are no active locks on the objects you are trying to export. Sometimes, system upgrades can leave locks that prevent further actions.

  2. Review Transport Logs:

    • Use Eclipse or other tools to check the transport logs for any indications of issues, such as locks or errors during the export process.

  3. Verify System Upgrade Status:

    • Confirm that the system upgrade has been fully completed and that all systems are on the same release version. This can affect the ability to export collections.

  4. Use Hotfix Collections: Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Hotfix

    • If regular export fails, try using a hotfix collection. Ensure that all dependencies are resolved before attempting the export.

  5. Check Extensibility Settings:

    • Use the Extensibility Settings app to verify if the items you are trying to export support import into higher versions. This can sometimes cause export issues.

If the issue persists, please don't hesitate to reach out again.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Sending Emails from SAP CAP Applications with Any SMTP Provider
entry.content:
Sending Emails from SAP CAP Applications with Any SMTP Provider

Step 1: Prepare Your Mail Account

  1. Enable 2-Step Verification if your provider requires it (Gmail does).
  2. Generate an App Password or special SMTP password. This is safer than using your regular password.

        Navigate to Google Account->Security

     

 

      Search application password

      

 

 

Step 2 : Create a Destination in SAP BTP Cockpit

A destination in BTP stores connection details to external systems (in this case, Gmail SMTP).
Here‚Äôs what you do:

  1. Go to your SAP BTP Cockpit ‚Üí Destinations.
  2. Create a new destination with:
    • Name: GmailSMTP
    • Type: SMTP
    • Authentication: BasicAuthentication
    • User: 
    • Password: The 16-character App Password generated from Google
    • Additional properties like host: smtp.gmail.com and port: 587

                 

 

Step 3: Create a CAP Application

Use the CAP Template Wizard in DevSpace to generate your project. Once created:

  1. Define a service with a function for sending emails in .cds:
service CatalogService { 
    function sendMail() returns String; 
}

 

  1. Implement it in .js:
const cds = require('@sap/cds');

const SapCfMailer = require("sap-cf-mailer").default;



module.exports = cds.service.impl(function () {

    this.on('sendMail', async () => {

        try {

            const transporter = new SapCfMailer("GmailSMTP"); // Match your destination

            const result = await transporter.sendMail({

                to: "", //to list separated by comma

                cc: "", //cc list separated by comma

                subject: "Test Mail from BTP System",

                html: "Hello from CAP!",

                attachments: []

            });

            return `Email sent successfully`;

        } catch (error) {

            console.error('Error sending email:', error);

            return `Error sending email: ${error.message}`;

        }

    });

});

 

Install the mailer library:

npm i sap-cf-mailer

 

Step 4: Bind Services in Cloud Foundry

If your CAP app is new, some required services‚Äîlike destination services‚Äîmight not exist yet. In that case:

  1. Build and deploy your MTA project. Even if the deployment isn‚Äôt fully successful, the necessary services will still be created.

       

       2.Go to Cloud Foundry ‚Üí Services and bind your app to the newly created destinations.

          

         3.After binding, your .env file will automatically include the credentials you need.

 If you‚Äôre working with an existing app, you can skip the MTA build ,just bind the Cloud Foundry services, and you‚Äôre ready to go.

Let‚Äôs test: Run cds watch and call sendMail from your browser. Check your inbox, your screenshot will show the email arriving.

 

Step 5: Sending HTML Emails

You can send nicely formatted emails with HTML. Just store your HTML in a variable and pass it to the html property:

 

this.on('sendMail', async () => {

        try {

            const transporter = new SapCfMailer("GmailSMTP"); //enter destination name



            const htmlContent = `<!DOCTYPE html>

                        <html>

                        <body style="margin:0;padding:0;background:#f6f7fb;font-family:Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">

                            <table role="presentation" width="100%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:#f6f7fb;">

                            <tr>

                                <td align="center" style="padding:24px;">

                                <table role="presentation" width="600" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="background:#ffffff;border-radius:12px;padding:24px;">

                                    <tr>

                                    <td>

                                        <h2 style="margin:0 0 12px;font-size:20px;color:#111;">Hello Mahesh üëã</h2>

                                        <p style="margin:0 0 16px;color:#333;line-height:1.5;">

                                        This is a quick test email from your SAP BTP CAP app. If you can read this, your mail setup works!

                                        </p>

                                        <p style="margin:0 0 24px;">

                                        <a href="https://example.com" style="display:inline-block;text-decoration:none;padding:10px 16px;border-radius:8px;background:#2563eb;color:#fff;">

                                            View Details

                                        </a>

                                        </p>

                                        <p style="margin:0;color:#666;font-size:12px;">

                                        ‚Äî CAP Mailer ‚Ä¢ <span style="color:#999;">Do not reply</span>

                                        </p>

                                    </td>

                                    </tr>

                                </table>

                                <p style="color:#999;font-size:12px;margin:12px 0 0;">¬© 2025 Your Company</p>

                                </td>

                            </tr>

                            </table>

                        </body>

                        </html>

`;



            const result = await transporter.sendMail({

                to: "",

                cc: "",

                subject: "Test Mail from BTP System",

                html: htmlContent,

                attachments: []

            });

            return `Email sent successfully w `;



        } catch (error) {

            console.error('Error sending email:', error);

            return `Error sending email: ${error.message}`;

        }

    });

Let‚Äôs test: Run cds watch and call sendMail from your browser. Check your inbox‚Äîyour screenshot will show the email arriving.

 

Step 6: Sending Attachments

To attach files, convert them to Base64 and include them in the attachments array:

 

this.on('sendMail', async () => {

        try {

            const transporter = new SapCfMailer("GmailSMTP"); //enter destination name

           

            const base64pdf=`JVBERi0xLjUKJeLjz9MKMSAwIG9iago8PC9UeXBlL1BhZ2UvUGFyZW50IDIgMCBSL1Jlc291

                cmNlcyA8PC9Gb250IDw8L0YxIDMgMCBSPj4+Pi9NZWRpYUJveFswIDAgNjEyIDc5Ml0vQ29u

                dGVudHMgNCAwIFI+PgplbmRvYmoKMiAwIG9iago8PC9UeXBlL1BhZ2VzL0tpZHNbMSAwIFJd

                L0NvdW50IDE+PgplbmRvYmoKMyAwIG9iago8PC9UeXBlL0ZvbnQvU3ViVHlwZS9UcnVlVHlw

                ZS9CYXNlRm9udC9UaW1lcy1Sb21hbi9FbmNvZGluZy9XaW5BbnNpRW5jb2Rpbmc+PgplbmRv

                YmoKNCAwIG9iago8PC9MZW5ndGggNjY+PnN0cmVhbQpCBiAgICAgICAgICAgIApIZWxsbyBX

                b3JsZCEKZW5kc3RyZWFtCmVuZG9iago1IDAgb2JqCjw8L1R5cGUvQ2F0YWxvZy9QYWdlcyAy

                IDAgUj4+CmVuZG9iagp4cmVmCjAgNgowMDAwMDAwMDAwIDY1NTM1IGYgCjAwMDAwMDAxMTkg

                MDAwMDAgbiAKMDAwMDAwMDY2IDAwMDAwIG4gCjAwMDAwMDAxMzAgMDAwMDAgbiAKMDAwMDAw

                MDE5MSAwMDAwMCBuIAowMDAwMDAwMjU3IDAwMDAwIG4gCnRyYWlsZXIKPDwvUm9vdCA1IDAg

                Ui9TaXplIDY+PgpzdGFydHhyZWYKMjg4CiUlRU9G

                `       ;



            const result = await transporter.sendMail({

                to: "",

                cc: "",

                subject: "Test Mail from BTP System",

                html: "Hope this goes well.",

                attachments:  [{ filename: "sample.pdf",    content: base64pdf,    encoding: "base64"  }]

            });

            return `Email sent successfully w `;



        } catch (error) {

            console.error('Error sending email:', error);

            return `Error sending email: ${error.message}`;

        }

    });

 

 

Conclusion:

By following these steps, we‚Äôve successfully sent emails directly from our SAP CAP application. The setup allows you to send plain text or richly formatted HTML emails, include multiple recipients, CCs, or attachments, and work securely using Gmail App Passwords, avoiding less secure app issues.

Everything we tested‚Äîsending a basic email, an HTML email, and attaching a PDF‚Äîworked smoothly, showing that this approach is ready for real-world use. Your CAP app can now reliably send notifications, reports, or alerts to users

entry.title: How to display multiple cover pages dynamically in single PDF - Adobe LiveCycle Designer
entry.content:
Requirement: 
To display multiple cover pages dynamically in sales quote PDF based on which cover page we need to display in the PDF.

Introduction:
This blog explains how to dynamically display cover page in a PDF based on the required cover page image, eliminating the need to create separate PDFs for each variation.

Problem Statement:
We had a requirement to display cover pages in Sales Quote custom PDF dynamically based on the cover page value (KUT field) we select in Sales Quote in SAP C4C.

Solution:
We can create multiple image fields with different cover page images as required and we can hide display only the required cover page based on cover page selected in SAP C4C and hide other cover pages in the PDF using JavaScript.

Benefits:
This method eliminates the process of creating different PDF for each cover page as we can dynamically display multiple cover pages based and selection in a single PDF, thereby reducing the development efforts of creating multiple PDF for each cover page.

Implementation Steps:
STEP 1:
Add multiple cover page images in the master page as shown below.


STEP 2:
Write JavaScript to hide the not required cover page image based on cover page image selected in SAP C4C. The JavaScript code can be written on subform level. Here in our example, we have written the JavaScript in Page3 subform.
Example:
You have two cover page image A and E in PDF. In C4C the cover page selected to display in PDF is ‚ÄúA‚Äù means in PDF image ‚ÄúE‚Äù should be hidden so that cover page ‚ÄúA‚Äù will be displayed in PDF.


STEP 3:
After completing the required changes, upload the latest PDF in ‚ÄúForm Template Maintenance‚Äù in SAP C4C and publish the upload.
Result:
Cover Page with code 111 is selected in C4C to display in PDF.


As shown in below JavaScript code if cover page code 111 needs to be displayed other cover page images are hidden


The cover page with code 111 is displayed in PDF as shown below.



Conclusion:
This blog explains how to display multiple cover pages in PDF dynamically based on selection. It will help the developer to eliminate the process of creating multiple PDF for each cover page, thereby saving time and Efforts of development.

entry.title: Targeted User Sync: Filtering in SAP Cloud Identity Services
entry.content:
Introduction


In many landscapes, user replication between SAP Cloud Identity Services and target systems is configured to include all users by default. While this approach works for smaller environments, it often leads to unnecessary data transfers, increased synchronization times, and the replication of accounts that should not have access to the target system.
This article demonstrates how to implement filtering in SAP Cloud Identity Services to ensure that only users with specific group assignments are replicated. By applying this targeted approach, you can optimize replication performance, reduce administrative overhead, and strengthen access governance across your SAP landscape.

 

References

Before we begin, it‚Äôs important to note that IAS SCIM API version 2 offers several filtering capabilities as properties. This allows us to implement the necessary transformations more easily using property-based filters.

  • üìÑSee SAP Note 3575834 ‚Äì IAS API V2 filter to read users from specific user groups in IPS and the official documentation: Source: Identity Authentication

You can find the complete list of Cloud Identity Services properties here:

  • List of Properties

For filtering, you can retrieve the required attributes via the Identity Directory API:

  • Users API (SCIM) ‚Äì In the ‚ÄúTry out‚Äù section, enter your tenant details to test queries directly. We will cover this in more detail later in the article.

Step-by-step Configuration

  1. Go to Identity Provisioning ‚Üí Source Systems in your SAP Cloud Identity Services admin console.

  2. Click the Properties tab in your source system configuration. Change the ias.api.version value to 2 to enable SCIM API v2 capabilities. Add the property ias.user.filter and specify your filtering rule. Save the changes.

    • In this example, a group-based filter is used:

groups.display eq "Test"

 

 

Extra ‚Äì How to Test Your Filter Without Updating the Configuration

If you want to verify your filtering logic before applying it to your configuration, you can test it directly using the Identity Directory API ‚Äì Try Out feature.

 

  • Go to the Try Out tab and select Add New Environment.

 

  • In the Configure New Environment dialog, fill in the following:

    • Tenant: Your IAS tenant name.

    • Display Name: Any name to identify the connection.
    • Starting URL: Leave as default https://{tenant}.{host}/scim.
    • Host: Your IAS host (e.g., accounts.ondemand.com).
    • Tenant: Your IAS tenant name.
    • Username
    • Password

 

 

 

  • Once the environment is configured, go to the Request section and enter your filter string in the filter parameter. For example:  emails.value eq "test@test.com"

 

Then click Run and review the Response section to verify that only the intended users are returned.

Conclusion

By leveraging IAS SCIM API v2 and property-based filtering, administrators can gain precise control over which users are replicated from SAP Cloud Identity Services to target systems. Implementing filtering not only improves performance by reducing unnecessary data transfers but also enhances security by ensuring that only authorized users are provisioned.

The Identity Directory API ‚Äì Try Out feature offers a safe way to validate your filters before deploying them in production, allowing for quick iteration and testing without impacting live configurations.

With these techniques, you can streamline your identity management processes, reduce administrative overhead, and maintain a cleaner, more controlled replication setup across your SAP landscape.

entry.title: Re: Plant Transfer via PO-SO Process Between GST-Register...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) answers your question?

To initiate a plant-to-plant transfer within the same company involving two different GST registrations through a Sales Order (SO) with reference to a Purchase Order (PO) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, follow these steps:

Steps to Proceed

  1. Create a Purchase Order (PO):

    • Start by creating a Purchase Order in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. This PO will serve as the reference for the Sales Order.

  2. Create a Sales Order (SO):

    • Use the Purchase Order created in the previous step to generate a Sales Order at the headquarters or the plant responsible for the transfer.
    • Ensure that the Sales Order references the Purchase Order to maintain the link between procurement and sales.

  3. Configure Communication Arrangements:

    • Set up communication arrangements in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to facilitate the transfer of data between the systems. This includes setting up communication users and systems.

  4. Map Purchase Orders to Sales Orders: Purchase Order to Sales Order Creation in a 2-Tier‚Ä¶

    • Use IDOCs (Intermediate Documents) to map the Purchase Orders to Sales Orders. This involves configuring the necessary IDOC types and process codes in the SAP On-Premise system.

  5. Monitor and Process IDOCs:

    • Ensure that the IDOCs are correctly processed and converted into Sales Orders in the On-Premise system.

  6. Create Outbound Delivery and Invoice:

    • Once the Sales Order is created, proceed with creating an outbound delivery and invoice for the goods being transferred.

  7. Post Goods Issue and Receipt:

    • Post the goods issue against the outbound delivery and create a goods receipt in the receiving plant.

  8. Create Inbound Invoice:

    • Use the ‚ÄòCreate Inbound Invoices for STOs - India‚Äô India - STO Processing for Interstate app to generate the inbound invoice for the receiving plant.

Important Considerations

  • Ensure that both plants have different GST registration numbers and that the necessary GST settings are configured.
  • Maintain the necessary master data information for both the supplying and receiving plants.

By following these steps, you can effectively manage the plant-to-plant transfer process through a Sales Order with reference to a Purchase Order, ensuring compliance with GST regulations and seamless integration across procurement, sales, and finance.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: How to expand default memory size for SAP S/4HANA Clo...
entry.content:
Hi @EikiK ,

the 100 GB displayed in ILM Advisor is a fixed value and is rather for illustration purpose. It does not necessarily correspond to the memory entitlement of your individual contract. For 2SL customers the default(!) memory entitlement is 100 GB, but customers can buy memory extensions. For 3SL there is a different default and also the way the memory consumption is calculated differes.
Please see Understanding HANA memory related license utilizat... - SAP Community for more details ... and please don't take the 100 GB in ILM Advisor too serious.

Best regards,

Claudia

entry.title: Re: 3D2: How can we proceed the step of preparing deliver...
entry.content:
Hello Ingrid,

Thank you very much for your question.

Please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) answers your question:

How to Include Advanced Shipment and Outbound Delivery in Scope Item 3D2

In the scope item 3D2 for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the process primarily focuses on service order management and monitoring. While the test script may not explicitly cover advanced shipment and outbound delivery, you can integrate these logistics processes by leveraging the capabilities of SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Steps to Integrate Advanced Shipment and Outbound Delivery:

  1. Service Order Creation: Begin by creating a service order in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Ensure that the service order includes the necessary details for logistics integration, such as spare parts or materials that need to be shipped.

  2. Stock Reservation: Reserve the required stock parts in a specific storage location. This can be done using the ‚ÄòManage Reservation Items‚Äô app, which allows you to edit manual reservations or stock transfer reservations created by MRP.

  3. Stock Transport Order (STO): Create a stock transport order to facilitate the transfer of stock from the warehouse to the technician van or customer location. This involves creating a purchase order of document type ‚ÄòUD‚Äô and maintaining the necessary header values.

  4. Outbound Delivery Creation: Use the ‚ÄòSchedule Delivery Creation‚Äô app to create an outbound delivery for the STO. The Power of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Processes ‚Äì Outbound Transportation Management This step involves picking, packing, and posting goods issue from the warehouse.

  5. Warehouse Tasks Execution: Execute pending warehouse tasks using the ‚ÄòRun Outbound Process ‚Äì Deliveries‚Äô app. This includes creating and confirming tasks, and posting the goods issue.

  6. Service Confirmation: After the delivery, create a service confirmation with the actual consumed quantities. This will post the goods issue for the consumed parts.

By following these steps, you can effectively integrate advanced shipment and outbound delivery into the 3D2 process, even if the test script does not explicitly cover these logistics aspects.

Additional Resources

  • For more detailed guidance, refer to SAP‚Äôs documentation on logistics integration for service orders Enhancing the Standard Part 1: Logistics integration for service orders in S/4HANA Cloud and outbound delivery processes.

[1] The Power of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Processes ‚Äì Outbound Transportation Management
[2] Enhancing the Standard Part 1: Logistics integration for service orders in S/4HANA Cloud
Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: SAP Datasphere & Python : One click to export data of mutiple views in Excel/CSV
entry.content:
Introduction

Currently, SAP Datasphere only allows data export through Analytical Models. That means for every fact view, one has to create a separate Analytical Model just to download the data. It‚Äôs not ideal, especially when you have many views. Exporting them one by one becomes slow and repetitive.

To solve this,  Python script was developed that connects to SAP Datasphere, runs a query on each view from list, and saves the results as Excel files in a local drive path which is predefined. Now  just run the script, and it exports everything in one go‚Äîno manual effort needed.

Requirements 

Before running the script, install the following Python packages:

These packages enable secure connectivity to SAP Datasphere and support efficient data handling.

pip install hdbcli
pip install sqlalchemy
pip install sqlalchemy-hana

Creating a Database User in SAP Datasphere

To enable Python connectivity, create a database user:

  1. Navigate to Space Management in SAP Datasphere
  2. Select the relevant space
  3. Click on Database Access
  4. Create a new user with read access
  5. Copy the host, port, username, and password

Helpful links : Create DB User in Datasphere Space  

Python Script

# üì¶ Install required packages (run these in your terminal or notebook)
# pip install hdbcli              # SAP HANA database client
# pip install sqlalchemy          # SQL toolkit and ORM for Python
# pip install sqlalchemy-hana     # SAP HANA dialect for SQLAlchemy

# üìö Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd               # For data manipulation and Excel export
from hdbcli import dbapi          # SAP HANA DBAPI for direct connection
import warnings                   # To suppress unnecessary warnings
import os                         # For file path and directory handling

# üö´ Suppress warnings for cleaner output
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# üîê Define SAP Datasphere connection parameters
# üëâ Replace the placeholders below with your actual connection details
db_user = '<your_database_user>'           # User with access to target schema
db_password = '<your_secure_password>'     # Password (handle securely)
db_host = '<your_datasphere_host_url>'     # Host URL (e.g., xyz.hanacloud.ondemand.com)
db_port = 443                               # Default HTTPS port for SAP HANA Cloud
db_schema = '<your_schema_name>'           # Target schema containing views

# üìÅ Ensure output folder exists for Excel exports
output_folder = r'C:\Datasphere\Excel export'  # Update path as needed
os.makedirs(output_folder, exist_ok=True)

# üìã Define list of views to extract data from
# üëâ Add or modify view names based on your schema
view_list = ['VIEW_1', 'VIEW_2']  # Example views

try:
    # üåê Establish secure connection to SAP Datasphere
    connection = dbapi.connect(
        address=db_host,
        port=db_port,
        user=db_user,
        password=db_password,
        encrypt=True,
        sslValidateCertificate=True
    )
    print("‚úÖ Connected to SAP Datasphere")

    cursor = connection.cursor()

    # üîÅ Loop through each view and export its data
    for view_name in view_list:
        try:
            # üìä Construct and execute SQL query
            sql_query = f'SELECT * FROM "{db_schema}"."{view_name}"'
            print(f"üìä Executing query: {sql_query}")
            cursor.execute(sql_query)

            # üì• Fetch results and convert to DataFrame
            rows = cursor.fetchall()
            columns = [desc[0] for desc in cursor.description]
            df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=columns)

            # üì§ Export DataFrame to Excel
            output_path = os.path.join(output_folder, f'{view_name}.xlsx')
            df.to_excel(output_path, index=False)
            print(f"‚úÖ Data from '{view_name}' saved to: {output_path}")

        except dbapi.Error as view_err:
            print(f"‚ùå Error querying '{view_name}': {view_err}")

except dbapi.Error as db_err:
    print(f"‚ùå Database error: {db_err}")
except Exception as ex:
    print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è Unexpected error: {ex}")
finally:
    # üîí Ensure connection is closed gracefully
    if 'connection' in locals():
        connection.close()
        print("üîí Connection closed")

Script Capabilities

  • Establishes secure connection to SAP Datasphere
  • Executes queries on each listed view
  • Saves data from each view into a separate Excel file
  • Stores all files in a defined folder

Only connection details and view names need to be updated. The script handles the rest.

 One-Click Execution with a .bat File

To simplify execution, create a  RunExport.bat file to run the Python script with a double-click.

Double-clicking the file will automatically export all views to Excel without opening a terminal

 off
REM Activate Python and run the Export script

REM Change to the script directory
cd /d "C:\Datasphere\Excel export"

REM Run the Python script
python Export.py

REM Pause to keep the window open (optional)
pause

Example

Before Execution 

Double Click on "RunExcel.bat" file

Post Execution

Conclusion
This automation simplifies data exports from SAP Datasphere, especially when working with multiple views.

  • It reduces manual effort
  • improves consistency and saves time.
  • ideal for recurring tasks or scheduled jobs.

For setup support or customization, feel free to connect.

Thanks

Vikas Parmar

SAP Datasphere SAP Business Data Cloud Python

entry.title: Re: unable to configure the download manager
entry.content:
The error 'The basket content could be read. Verify your logon credentials or private certificate key and try again.' typically occurs due to an incorrect password being used in the SAP Download Manager. 

To resolve this issue, please ensure that you are using your S-user password in the SAP Download Manager, rather than your Universal ID (UID) password, which is specifically for accessing SAP for Me. Please kindly note that the SAP Download Manager does not support SAP Universal ID password, as explained in KBA 3016110 - Software download issues while using SAP Universal ID - SAP Download Manager. 

If you are unsure of the password for your individual S-user ID, please reset your S-user Password using either of the methods below: 

How to change password using SAP Account Manager(only apply to the situation that S-user ID is linked to Universal ID)

  1. Go to the SAP Account Manager
  2. Log on with your SAP Universal ID credentials
  3. Select the linked S-user ID you would like to modify
  4. Click the button with the three dots in the upper right corner
  5. Click 'Reset Password'

How to change password using Forgot My Password 

  1. Go to Forgot My Password page
  2. Enter your S-user ID: S00XXXXX890 
  3. Click on Continue button
  4. An e-mail will be sent from SAP ID Service (ias@notifications.sap.com) to the e-mail address registered for the user.
  5. Open the e-mail to find the password reset link.

More detail on how to reset an S-user password can be found in 1808560 - How to reset an S-user ID password - SAP for Me

Hope this information is helpful to you!

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to contact us.

Kind Regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Organizational Structure - SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud
entry.content:
Organizational Structure - SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud

In order to understand the organogram of any organization, it is essential to learn the functions of every org unit. Just like in a family, some people play the roles of guardians, supervisors and some are only dependents on elder, likewise SAP org units are. 
Every organization utilizes its resources to earn profits so from where can we extract the profitability reports? It means there is a unit made responsible to collect information, analyse and report it in every manner that is "CO-PA". (Controlling- Profitability Segment). So, Operating Concern is like a super power who sits on the top of the org structure and have all the information. In SAP Public Cloud one operating concern is predefined with name of A000 therefore CO Consultant do not need to create any other.   It is assigned to controlling area, where all variable and fixed costs of the company is stored. Just like there cannot remain two swords in one sheath, similarly two controlling areas cannot be created. In SAP Public Cloud one controlling area is predefined with name of A000 therefore CO Consultant do not need to create any other. 

The world of Finance begin when companies start trading, hence just like we have multiple universes, multiple company codes are assigned to controlling areas. Company code is the smallest org structure in FI that stores all financial documents line items. It becomes a base for MM and SD structure, an independent family member upon which other gets dependent. Company codes nomenclature can be alpha-numeric. FI Consultant will begin the org structure creation activity in SAP Public Cloud. Lets take one scenario as an example. lets say a group of companies will be made as a company and its subsidiaries will be configured as separate company codes. 

Plant is the area which is responsible to record every production activity. What is happening inside a plant, cannot be known to that person who is sitting on the head of the family chair on the dining table. (CO-PA). Therefore, MM Consultant configures the alphanumeric plants to the company codes and with this relation, correct information passes to controlling area and reports of profit gets extracted. Profit is made of Revenue-Costs, so costs are available with controlling area, but what about revenue? 

So we have another stream, another module i,e SD who is solely responsible to dispatch and record sales. Then like a river, it flows into the sea of Finance and gets connected to CO-PA. 

MM and SD are two extreme opposite sides, SD is a plus and MM is minus. (Inflows and outflows) MM has its own purchasing org, that can either be centralized or decentralized as per company's policies. 
Similarly, SD has its own sales org,  SD consultant can assign one on multiple company codes or create a decentralized structure. 

In connection to controlling area. CO consultant designs a hierarchy of cost centers and profit centers to record their activities. Purchases can be found in multiple cost centers, and via report it can be plan to control it. Whereas, sales can be assigned profitability segments to know their contributions in profit figures. 

Under plant, multiple storage locations for inventory can be configured and assigned and under the same plant, sales area is made. Sales area is the combination of sales org, divisions and distribution channel. The longest activity in org structure is of SD module.  

The material is either procured externally or produced in-house, it moves from plant to warehouse, then stamped in sales office, it dispatches from shipping points to final consumer and consumer happily transfers the receipt in company's bank account. That's how production is materialized into finance. 

Please note no consultant can begin configuration without completing the organisational structure. 

It can be edited and recreated later on. but it will lock your workspace for sometime. After doing changes, confirm the units and deploy it onto your configuration server. 

Reports are formulated with the help of transactions, if a purchase order is made in MM, check the org units, (plant, purchasing org and storage location)  will be filled, so automatically it will be assigned to its respective company code and would reach CO-PA. SD will also follow the same in its preliminary financial documents. Hence, create a strong structure to uphold the data in correct formats and form. 

Till now, we have CO-FI-MM and SD in the picture and that's how organisational structure is framed in SAP S/4 Hana Public Cloud. The role of CO is predefined, in Grey cannot be changed in any circumstances.

entry.title: Re: Upload Program to Update Equipment Status in IE02 ‚Äì I...

Hi

'TESTNUMBER123' is not a valid object number. You need to concatenate 'IE' with your equipment number with leading zeroes. And 'TEST' is not a valid status. Take the statuses from your screenshot and check in table TJ30T for the internal object code (starting with 'E' and a 4 digit code, for example 'E0001', 

Lastly, keep in mind that (based on your screenshot) you are using status with status numbers. Which means that there is usually a sequence defined along with some logic what is allowed and what isn't. You therefore need to check your config whether your status change is actually allowed.

P.S.
Please read up on status management and familiarise yourself with how it works in SAP

entry.title: New fields available for Mexico electronic invoices
entry.content:
Hello, everybody 

Let‚Äôs dive into the latest updates regarding the additional tags for complemento in electronic invoice XMLs, as allowed by Mexican government authorities. These tags are categorized as follows: 

  • Complemento for the complemento tag 
  • Complementoconcepto for the concepto tag 
     

Our localization team has developed two new Business Add-Ins (BAdIs), which are set to be delivered in the upcoming release for S/4HANA Public Cloud. These enhancements allow you to dynamically create tags, as allowed by the government. 
 
The new BAdIs are: 

  • Mexico: Extending Fields for Complemento Header Node (EDOC_MX_FILL_COMPLEMENTO_HEADR): extend fields for the Complemento node in the XML or PDF for electronic documents. 
  • Mexico: Extending Fields for Complemento Concepto Node (EDOC_MX_FILL_COMPLMNT_CONCEPTO): extend fields for the Complemento Concepto node in the XML or PDF file for electronic documents. 

 

To implement new complementos for Conceptos, such as ventavehiculos or instEducativas you need to use the BAdI EDOC_MX_FILL_COMPLMNT_CONCEPTO. Additionally, it is necessary to perform some steps in iFlow, regardless of whether you are using the standard or a custom version. 

 

Configuring the iFlow: 

  1. In Integration flow select: Runtime Configuration -> Namespace Mapping

       1.1 Add the Namespace Mapping: "ventavehiculos( ;xmlns:ventavehiculos=http://www.sat.gob.mx/ventavehiculos )", as below: 
 

ventavehiculos( ;xmlns:ventavehiculos=http://www.sat.gob.mx/ventavehiculos )

  1. In Integration flow, select: References -> Mappings -> copyComprabantev4. 

You have to adjust the file copyComprabantev4.xsl 

       2.1 Add: "xmlns:ventavehiculos=http://www.sat.gob.mx/ventavehiculos" ‚Äì as displayed 

xmlns:ventavehiculos=http://www.sat.gob.mx/ventavehiculos

2.2 Add: xsl element for each complemento you want to use the file copyComprabantev4.xsl. In this example, ventavehiculos, but for instEducativas, you can do the same. 

<xsl:template match="cfdi:ComplementoConcepto//*"> 
      <xsl:element name="ventavehiculos:{local-name()}"> 
            <xsl:apply-templates select="@*|node()" /> 
      </xsl:element> 
</xsl:template>

 

 3.  In Integration flow, select: References -> Mappings -> Scripts -> identifyComplementov5.   You have to adjust the file: 

Add the following data: 

a) 

 def ventavehiculos = map.get("ventavehiculos");


b) 

namespaces = namespaces.concat(" http://www.sat.gob.mx/ventavehiculos http://www.sat.gob.mx/sitio_internet/cfd/ventavehiculos/ventavehiculos11.xsd");



4.  In Iflow, select Content Modifier and  Exchange Property to add ventavehiculos. 

You need to add the property below: 

  • Name: 
ventavehiculos
  • Data Type:
 java.lang.Boolean
  • Value: 
//*[local-name()='ventavehiculos']

 

      5. Save and deploy the iFlow. 

Keep in mind that this example demonstrated how to use the ventavehiculos tag. For the  insteducativas, you need to follow the same steps, ensuring adjustments according to its specific namespace and fields in each step. 
 
Did you like this post? Give it a Like (kudo) and share the content with your colleagues. Feel free to leave feedback, comment, or question in the space below.  
 
Reagards, 
Newton

entry.title: Re: Workflow condition for Purchase Order ‚Äì How to read P...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) answers your question?

How to Get Plant Information for a PO at Creation Time in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud

When creating a Purchase Order (PO) in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, you may encounter a situation where the PO number is not yet available, making it difficult to access certain data like the Plant information. Here are some steps and considerations to help you achieve this:

1. Use BAdI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF S/4HANA Public Cloud Workflow with New Custom Pre-Condition for Procurement

  • Condition Definition: This BAdI allows you to define custom conditions for workflow scenarios. You can specify conditions that need to be met for the workflow to trigger.

2. Use BAdI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Flexible Workflow with new custom pre-condition for

  • Business Logic Validation: This BAdI is used to evaluate the conditions defined in the previous step. It checks whether the conditions are met and sets the cv_is_true parameter accordingly.

3. Accessing Plant Information

  • Draft Mode Challenge: When a PO is in draft mode, the PO number (is_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_1) is not yet available, which complicates accessing the Plant information.

  • Alternative Approach: While there is no direct CDS view like i_purchaseorderitemapidraft for draft POs, you can explore using other available APIs or tables that might store draft data temporarily. Unfortunately, specific APIs for draft data retrieval are not mentioned in the provided context.

4. Custom Logic

  • Custom Fields and Logic App: You can use this app to implement custom logic that might help in accessing draft data or setting conditions based on other available parameters.
[1] S/4HANA Public Cloud Workflow with New Custom Pre-Condition for Procurement
[2] SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Flexible Workflow with new custom pre-condition for Purchase Requisition
Kind regards,
Henrike

entry.title: Re: Request to process an invisible SAP for Me Service Re...
entry.content:
The reason why you are unable to raise request "Set Up Hyperscaler AWS Transit Gateway" is because you don't have the necessary authorization to do so. After conducting research on S-user ID S00xxxxxxxx, it was discovered that your S-user is currently only assigned the Create Billable Service Requests permission at the installation level, and not at the customer number level.

To obtain the necessary authorization, it is advisable to utilize the Self-Service Request option (KBA 2891528) or reach out to your Super Administrator directly as indicated in Users & Contacts - SAP for Me.

For more detailed information on S-user authorizations required the Private Cloud Service Request application, please refer to KBA 2669783 - S-user authorizations required for the Private Cloud Service Request application - SAP for Me 

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Converting a Smart Filter into a Smart MultiComboBox in SAPUI5
entry.content:
Introduction

Sometimes a regular Smart Filter isn‚Äôt enough ,especially when the field values are case-sensitive.
By switching to a Smart MultiComboBox filter, we can let users pick multiple exact matches from a predefined list, avoiding case-related headaches and making filtering faster.

 

Prerequisites

  • A CAPM entity your Smart Table is bound to.
  • A group-by view  or entity that will return distinct values for your filter field.

 

Step 1: Understanding the current filter setup

Right now, your Smart Filter Bar probably has a multi-value token input for status.
We‚Äôre going to replace that with a MultiComboBox so users can simply tick the statuses they want, without worrying about typing the exact case.

 

Step 2: Create the dropdown source entity

Here‚Äôs an example CDS view to provide unique status values:

entity StatusDropDown as

    select from mlc.Employees {
      key status
    } group by status;
  • key status ‚Üí Marks status as the unique identifier in the list.
  • group by status ‚Üí Ensures we only get distinct statuses (case-sensitive).
  • This becomes the data source for the MultiComboBox items.

Step 3: Add XML namespaces

Make sure your XML file includes:

xmlns:smartfilterbar="sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar"

xmlns:smartField="sap.ui.comp.smartfield"

xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"

Step 4: Replace smart filter with a Smart MultiComboBox

<smartfilterbar:ControlConfiguration

    key="status"

    index="30"

    label="Status"

    visibleInAdvancedArea="true"

    filterType="searchExpression"

    groupId="_BASIC">

   

    <smartfilterbar:customControl>

        <MultiComboBox

            id="StatusDropDown"

            items="{path: '/StatusDropDown', sorter: {path: 'status'}}">

            <items>

                <core:Item key="{status}" text="{status}" />

            </items>

        </MultiComboBox>

    </smartfilterbar:customControl>

</smartfilterbar:ControlConfiguration>
  • We bind the MultiComboBox to the /StatusDropDown entity.
  • The status field is both the key and display text.
  • Sorting ensures the list looks organized.

 

Step 5: Hook into beforeRebindTable

Add this in your Smart Table XML:

beforeRebindTable="onBeforeRebindTable"

Step 6: Import libraries in your controller

"sap/ui/model/Filter",
"sap/ui/model/FilterOperator",

 

Step 7: Filtering logic for multiple selections

onBeforeRebindTable: function (oEvent) {

    const oBindingParams = oEvent.getParameter("bindingParams");

    const aStatus = this.getView().byId("StatusDropDown").getSelectedKeys();

    if (aStatus && aStatus.length > 0) {
        const orFilters = aStatus.map(status =>
            new Filter("status", FilterOperator.EQ, status)
        );

        oBindingParams.filters.push(
            new Filter({ filters: orFilters, and: false }) // OR logic
        );

    }

}

Step 8: Test it out

Reload the app, open the filter bar, and you should see your MultiComboBox instead of the regular filter.
Pick a few statuses  and the table should only show matching records.

 

Conclusion

By converting a multi-value Smart Filter into a Smart MultiComboBox, we:

  • Gave users the flexibility to select multiple exact matches without typing.
  • Avoided case-sensitivity issues by letting the system pull valid values directly from the backend.
  • Made the filtering process faster and more reliable for real-world datasets where values like Active, active, and ACTIVE might all exist.

This approach is clean, reusable, and works seamlessly with Smart Table + Smart Filter Bar setups in SAPUI5.

entry.title: Re: Error: configuring Flexible Workflow item to return t...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) answers your question?

Error Activating Workflow for Purchasing Contract

It seems you are encountering an error related to the agent rule ‚Äò/RULE/WF_INITIATOR‚Äô not being defined in the scenario for the step ‚ÄòReworkCTR‚Äô. This error typically occurs when the workflow configuration is missing necessary definitions or conditions.

Steps to Resolve:

  1. Check Agent Rule Definition: Ensure that the agent rule ‚Äò/RULE/WF_INITIATOR‚Äô is properly defined in your workflow scenario. You might need to access the app ‚ÄòManage Workflows for Purchase Contracts‚Äô How to Configure the Flexible Workflow for Purchase Contracts and verify the agent determination rules. Workflow Features for Purchase Contracts

  2. Scenario Activation: Make sure that the scenario is activated correctly. You can do this by navigating to the configuration environment and checking the activation status of the workflow scenario.

  3. Custom Logic: If you are using custom logic for agent determination, ensure that the implementation is correct and published. You can use the ‚ÄòCustom Logic‚Äô app to verify and update your BAdI implementations.

  4. SAP Notes: Although you mentioned SAP Note 3372372, it might not be applicable for your situation. However, you can check for any relevant SAP Notes that might address similar issues in the SAP Public Cloud environment.

Source Documents
[1] How to Configure the Flexible Workflow for Purchase Contracts
[2] Workflow Features for Purchase Contracts
Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: SAP Successfactors compensation - control compensation eligibility via MDF
entry.content:
Introduction:

This blog helps to do config steps required to in SAP SF Compensation, you can govern employee eligibility through custom MDF and business rules.

  • Creating a MDF object,

  • Designing business rules,

  • Associating those rules with the compensation templates.

Scenario: There would be a  requirement based on MDF object, writing a business rule for the eligibility in Successfactors Compensation. 

Create a Custom MDF Object:

  • We need to create a custom MDF object that will store the eligibility criteria for your compensation plan template. 
  • For example, create an object based on to track performance ratings, bonus eligibility, or other factors relevant to compensation. 

Define Eligibility Rules:

  • Use the MDF Business Rule Engine to create eligibility rules based on the custom MDF object. Use the base object as Employment Details
  • These rules will determine which employees are eligible for compensation based on the data stored in the MDF object. 

 

If you have a field in Employee Central or a MDF Table which will determine eligibility you can set the eligibility in the Design Worksheet.

    1. From the template, navigate to Plan Setup; Design Worksheet; Design Worksheet
    2. From the drop down that defaults to Form Fields choose Eligibility Fields
    3. Click Add Eligibility Column
    4. Choose Compensation and Salary (Tab) and Click Done
    5. For Each field, map the eligibility to the correct field in EC or on the MDF

Map Eligibility Rule to Compensation Plan:

  • Map the Business rule to your compensation plan template under plan details, Eligibility

Apply the rule, then based on MDF the eligible employee will appear in the worksheet accordingly.

Conclusion:

By creating a custom MDF object, defining business rules with the MDF Business Rules Engine, and then mapping these rules to your compensation plan, you can build a flexible  eligibility in SAP SuccessFactors

entry.title: Singleton Entities in RAP Design, Multi Line Edit, and Best Practices
entry.content:
In  this blog I have explained creating of an RAP Singleton entity  with multiline edit  functionalities , and also coevered below topics 
1.copy action

2. Depricate actions

3.invalidating entries

4.transport organizer 

  • Add Copy Action : Helps to create new entries in object page 

In case we have  lot of fields and we  need to refer existing entries --> and based on that if we want to create new entries we can make use of this action 

  • Add Deprecate Action :  If we want to deprecate some entries ( make it invalid )  

We can make use of this action  

Select to include a deprecate and invalidate action in the generated app 

Pre requisite : the table must have  a field CONFIGDEPRECATIONCODE with data element CONFIG_DEPRECATION_CODE  

  • Data Consistency Check : select this option to include a validation for the prepare draft action in the generated app which checks the consistency  of the input fields with  

Domain with fixed values 

Foreign keys where @abapCatalog.foreign key.screenCheck : true 

 If we have foreign key relationship / data element / domain 

( suppose we have gender field in the employee table --> we need to maintain it in the 

Domain level ) 

We can make use of  this field. 


<< 

Enable Transport Selection selected  

  • The transport request selection action displayed in edit mode 
  • The transport request information is displayed in the header toolbar 
  • If the save action is executed without  selected transport request and the transport is mandatory , the action to select a transport request is triggered automatically . 
  • After  selecting  a transport request , the save action continues  

 

If the action is not selected , a transport selection is made possible using an action button . This option is selected by default    

 

< Manual :   

 Select manual to include the action select transport  in the generated app 

With this action , you can select an existing customizing transport request before saving the configuration changes  

< Manual with pre selection  

To include the action select transport in the generated app .  

With this action , you can select an existing customizing transport request before saving the configuration changes. When the edit action is performed , a customizing transport request is determined automatically 

< No transport : Select No transport for an app without a transport suitable  fro configurations that are to be adjusted in the productive system 

 

 T1. take a custom table say employee 

@EndUserText.label : 'employee table' 
@AbapCatalog.enhancement.category : #NOT_EXTENSIBLE 
@AbapCatalog.tableCategory : #TRANSPARENT 
@AbapCatalog.deliveryClass : #C 
@AbapCatalog.dataMaintenance : #ALLOWED 
define table zpd_dt_em { 

key client : abap.clnt not null; 
key employee_id : zpd_de_emp not null; 
@EndUserText.label : 'First Name' 
first_name : abap.char(50); 
@EndUserText.label : 'Last Name' 
last_name : abap.char(50); 
@EndUserText.label : 'Department' 
department : abap.char(20); 
@EndUserText.label : 'Joining Date' 
joining_date : abap.dats; 
@EndUserText.label : 'Active Employee' 
is_active : abap.char(1); 
@EndUserText.label : 'Changed By' 
changed_by : abap.char(12); 
configdeprecationcode : config_deprecation_code; 
local_last_changed_at : abp_locinst_lastchange_tstmpl; 
changed_at : abp_lastchange_tstmpl; 

}

2. Create a LANGUAGE TABLE : 

Here we need one  entry ‚Äì so we have selected I_Language and put into the  

Where condition so that we get one entry to achieve singleton  

3.  select table and click on select generate repository objects

4. 

5.Delivery class must be C 

6. Data maintenance should be allowed

7.Also we need to have a data element( domain )

8. Provide package

9. We have business service definition and binding 

10. 

.Also, we have singleton entity details 

  • Singleton entity name ( EmployeeTableAll) 
  • Interface view ( Zi_EmployeeTable_S) 
  • Projection view  ( Zi_EmployeeTable_S) 
  • Key field (SinlgetonID) 
  • Draft table (zpd_dt_empl_d_s) 

11. Table details 

12. we can be able to see the classes 

 

13. we have scenario option 

 

 

 

14 Transport selection : 

 

 

15. activate the service binding

16. All the atrifacts will be generated 

intreface view:

@EndUserText.label: 'employee table' 
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #MANDATORY 
@Metadata.allowExtensions: true 

define view entity ZI_EmployeeTable1 
as select from ZPD_DT_EM 
association to parent ZI_EmployeeTable_S1 as _EmployeeTableAll on $projection.SingletonID = _EmployeeTableAll.SingletonID 
association [0..*] to I_ConfignDeprecationCodeText as _ConfignDeprecationCodeText on $projection.ConfigDeprecationCode = _ConfignDeprecationCodeText.ConfigurationDeprecationCode 

{ 

key EMPLOYEE_ID as EmployeeId, 
FIRST_NAME as FirstName, 
LAST_NAME as LastName, 
DEPARTMENT as Department, 
JOINING_DATE as JoiningDate, 
IS_ACTIVE as IsActive, 
CHANGED_BY as ChangedBy, 
@ObjectModel.text.association: '_ConfignDeprecationCodeText' 
@Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [ {

entry.title: Re: Discrepancy in Amount Calculation D
entry.content:
SAP calculates taxes at the item level, then sums them up at the header. If rounding is applied per item, the total tax may differ slightly from what you'd expect if calculated on the full base amount. This is especially noticeable with GST at 18%, where fractional values (e.g., 1138.68) are rounded inconsistently.

Coming to your issue, not sure, how currently, your system set up is and I presume, it is GST India. Maintain the standard settings for rounding by following the below steps

In OBQ1, maintain the rounding rule under "Control data 1" tab
Specify the rounding rules in ob90
check in your SD pricing procedure, whether routines 16 or 17 is assigned to your tax condition type

For information, Routine 16 will round the tax value per item, whereas, for Routine 17, instead of rounding each item‚Äôs tax and summing, SAP will calculate tax on the total and round once.  So for your issue, it is better to assign Routine 17

Let us take an example of the issue you shared and assume, you set Routine 17 which will calculate as under

  • Total Base: ‚Çπ6576.00
  • GST @18%: ‚Çπ1183.68
  • Final Invoice: ‚Çπ7759.68 (rounded correctly)

Once these changes are carried out, create a new sale order and complete the full cycle. Check how GST flows now.

entry.title: SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
Why this matters: the upcoming changes turn what looked like a technical switch into a strategic decision that can affect your budget, compliance posture, and HCM roadmap. Activations of Business Function for SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA directly influence whether you need additional HCM licenses, which capabilities you can keep on-premise versus in Private Cloud, and how quickly you should plan a move to SuccessFactors for certain functions. Getting ahead of this now helps you avoid unplanned costs or audit exposure, prevents disruption to HR processes tied to payroll, time, and regulatory reporting, and gives you time to align contracts, license product codes, and project timelines. The guidance below distills what‚Äôs changing and the practical steps to stay compliant while keeping your transformation on track.

Starting with SAP S/4HANA 2025, the Business Function for SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA‚ÄØ will be turned on by default. From this release on, there is no compatibility pack for HCM anymore. ‚ÄØThis technical change is not reversible. The licensing requirements are applicable when SAP HCM is utilized beyond the scope of the HR Mini Master, in cases where the customer is conducting HCM processes in the system.

For the technical details, please check the KBA 3443536 - SAP S/4HANA Release 2025 will be delivered with active H4S4_1 Business Function - SAP for Me 

Some functionality is not available in S/4HANA Private Cloud; e.g. SAP Learning Solution is available in S/4HANA on-premise, when moving to Private Cloud, the go-to solution is SuccessFactors Learning.

You can see the details of what features are enabled and what are disabled you can check in the following note 3091160 - SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì General Approach and Strategy - SAP for Me 

A customer using the HCM compatibility pack today in SAP S/4HANA on-premise can receive a prolongation only if they move to SAP S/4HANA Cloud, private edition, via a lift-and-shift (like-for-like) migration that preserves the current release. If the move includes an upgrade to the 2025 release, the H4S4_1 business function will be active by default, and the HCM compatibility pack will no longer be available, so prolongation does not apply.  With the requested change, they would get the prolongation as well in case they directly move to SuccessFactors, which is our strategic intent.

HCM License Materials and Usage Rights 

 

Customers must also license SAP HCM for SAP S/4HANA latest the first day after the expiry of the Compatibility Package.

Please contact your account executive to plan the license conversion as soon as possible. 

I hope you found this blog post helpful. If you did, please give it a "like" or share it. I‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts and feedback, so feel free to leave a comment. If you have any questions, just drop them in the Q&A section with the tags SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. We'll try to get back to you as soon as we can.


Thanks,

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA RIG team.

entry.title: Re: SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA ‚Äì App Variants are the EASY way to control App Features
entry.content:
Hi Hilderink, Thanks for your feedback. 

I can see some merit in suggesting a better way to map app variants to LADIs in the technical catalogs via the Adaptation Mode of Launchpad App Manager - at the very least it might be helpful to have a way to select app variants based on the original app id.  You might want to think it over and suggest an idea in the Continuous Influence program for Digital Experience https://influence.sap.com/sap/ino/#/campaign/2279 This would bring it to the attention of other customers for similar needs to start the journey to getting it on the roadmap. 

Re duplicating entries in the business catalog - that should not be necessary and might be a possible cause of your issues?  We would typically envision that different roles would have different business catalogs as business catalogs drive which apps (including app variants) are assigned to which users.

  • Each business catalog can reference one or more entries from the underlying technical catalog.
  • Different business catalogs could have the same SemanticObject-Action pair targeting different app variants. 

E.g.

  • Role Z_BR_XXX_EDIT includes business catalog Z_BC_XXX_EDIT which references the original app
  • Role Z_BR_XXX_DISPLAY includes business catalog Z_BC_XXX_DISPLAY which references the app variant

Re Authorizations versus App Variants - these 2 approaches are intended to be complimentary. They are not a replacement for each other. 

Authorizations control what you are allowed to do. Even if a button is visible, if you are not authorized to perform the underlying action you will get an error. These can often be fine-grained, e.g. you might have access to edit Sales Orders but are restricted to editing Sales Orders of a certain sales order type only. In which case, you still need the edit button to be available.

App Variants control visibility - that covers a whole range of UX changes such as:

  • Showing/placing optional fields - including SAP predefined fields and custom fields
  • Showing/hiding buttons, tabs, cards, etc.
  • Creating public views for filter settings, table settings, chart settings, card settings. 

 App variants improve usability by refining the app for the use case.

Perhaps you could think through those suggestions through and see if that helps you.

P.s. A launchpad plug-in would not be suitable. ... as these are applied asynchronously (so the button could show and then disappear..!) We tend to use those for launchpad features. 

Hope that helps

entry.title: Re: ST-PI Version Compatibility Between SAP Solution Mana...
entry.content:
Hello team,

This is correct, ST-PI and ST/A-PI are the Software Components that contain all the code (Function Modules and Reports) to collect data from Managed Systems. 

Both are installed in SAP Solution Manager and Managed Systems, because we collect data from both sides.

The version is linked to the Netweaver version, so it might be different version comparing Solution Manager and Managed System.

To check latest available version, you can run Transaction ST13, tool RTCCTOOL  which will provide relevant SAP Notes in case an update is required. 

Keeping these Software Components fully updated, will ensure there is no data collection issue due to code bugs. 

Regards,

Luis Salazar

entry.title: Re: Cross data locking
entry.content:
SAP authorization objects like K_CSKA (for cost elements) and K_CCTR (for cost centers) do not evaluate combinations. They check whether a user has access to a cost element or a cost center, but not whether they‚Äôre allowed to use a specific pair.

With some custom validation, you can meet this requirement. Explore BADI_FAGL_POSTING or BADI_K_KKB_AUTHORITY with which you can build logic to block specific combinations like 20321078 + 210020. Maintain the required combination like Cost Element 210020 / Cost Center 20321078 and User ID in TVARVC table. With the above BAdI, whenever user tries to create order or posting, system to check this table and if maintained, allow to proceed; else, throw an error. With this approach, at a later date, for some reasons, if you want to add a new entry or delete the existing entry, users can do on their own and no need for code change.

entry.title: Re: Enhancement or Exits to Campaing PCA1
entry.content:
To make the field GPROZGR mandatory on both the initial and second screen, you‚Äôll need to identify the screen number and field name.

For that, you can go from the transaction screen itself where from the top menu bar, click on System > Status so that it will show the screen number. The other option is via SE51, you can get these details. The correct technical name for GPROZGR is GRPNAME. To find out a related BAdI, go to SE18 and input ES_SAPLCPC1 in the Enhancement Spot field. This will list out all BAdIs

entry.title: Re: which is the difference between country key and repor...
entry.content:
In the context of fiscal representation, it's appropriate to use the fields as follows:

Country Key: This should reflect the parent company's country of registration‚Äîi.e., the country where the legal entity is based. It identifies the origin of the company involved in the transaction.

Reporting Country: This should indicate the country where the fiscal representative is registered and where the invoice will be reported for tax purposes. This is typically the country in which VAT or other indirect taxes are declared.

entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

We received the cash receipt/bank statement in company code DE01, but the invoice we are trying to apply the payment to was created in FR01. When attempting to apply the cash directly, we encounter a tax error stating:

As a workaround, we currently follow this process:

entry.title: Re: ST-PI Version Compatibility Between SAP Solution Mana...
entry.content:
Hello Rsnit and Luis,

Thanks very much for your input. I‚Äôve reviewed several SAP sources and found some relevant distinctions.

In one SAP blog, it‚Äôs stated that:

‚ÄúIt is highly recommended to keep software component ST-PI at the latest support package level (see SAP Note 539977) in Managed System as well as in the Solution Manager system. [‚Ä¶] The data collector changes provided in higher support packages are downward compatible e.g. a Solution Manager on ST 710 SP 12 can call a data collector in a managed system with ST-PI 2008_1_ SP 13.‚Äù*

This suggests that certain ST-PI functionalities, like data collectors, are designed to be downward compatible.

However, in SAP Note 69455 regarding ST-A/PI, it‚Äôs mentioned:

‚ÄúMay occur if the satellite system is on ST-A/PI >=01L but Solution Manager does not yet have the ST-SER 701_2008_2 [‚Ä¶] RTCCTOOL was enhanced [‚Ä¶] but the older Solution Manager release does not yet understand this.‚Äù

This indicates that other functionalities, such as RTCCTOOL integration with EarlyWatch Alert, may not be compatible if Solution Manager is on an older release.

Therefore, it seems there is no general SAP note that guarantees full downward compatibility across all ST-PI and ST-A/PI functionalities. While best practice remains to keep versions aligned, where this isn‚Äôt feasible, does SAP officially guarantee downward compatibility when the managed system is on a higher release than Solution Manager?

Best regards,
Silvio

entry.title: Re: Avatar Stack sizing in SAP MDK
entry.content:
I have tried both - images on RAP service (but I have encountered problems with CORS headers on my company test server), then I moved my images to folder Images in app. I am not sure what you mean by page metadata.

I got this reference in page code to avatar stack. I am using simple js rule.

export default function ProductListImage(clientAPI) {
    const binding = clientAPI.getBindingObject();

    if (binding && binding.ProductPictureURL) {
        try {
            const originalPath = binding.ProductPictureURL; //on my service this is as urls, but i had this problem with CORS headers.
            const fileName = originalPath.substring(originalPath.lastIndexOf('/') + 1); //So i downloaded images and i am changing url into path
            const newRelativePath = '/.../Images/';
            const finalUrl = newRelativePath + fileName; //this is correct final path, something like /myapp/Images/image1.jpg
            return finalUrl;
...placeholders, error handling etc.
basically it changes /sap/opu/odatav4/.../img1.jpg to /myapp/Images/image1.jpg and images are stored in this path

entry.title: Re: Skipping popup messages in VA03 for Sales Order Incom...
entry.content:
SAP Note 1459252 suggests this only as a workaround, not a standard solution. It‚Äôs not part of core functionality, so it should be treated as a last resort.

If the goal is to reduce user frustration without compromising data integrity:

  • First, analyze which fields are causing the incompletion logs.
  • Then, adjust the incompletion procedure to remove non-critical fields.
  • Use BAdIs or user exits to suppress popups for completed orders.
  • Only consider deleting from VBUV if all else fails; and always back up the data first.

We recently completed an upgrade from SAP S/4HANA 2021 to SAP S/4HANA 2023 (Private Cloud Edition). After raising a service request regarding post-upgrade checks, SAP responded by referring us to SAP Note 2907976 ‚Äì Silent Data Migration (SDMI).

I would like to understand:

entry.title: Re: The Value of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) in The Context of Business Steering
entry.content:
Hi @thomaselit,

Great feedback and I will try to address it:

Besides the mentioned (and ‚Äúexcluded‚Äù) components SAP BDC is also introducing new services. Such as:

  1. Curated SaaS Data products
  2. Intelligent Apps
  3. SAP Databricks (for AI/ML) use cases

We are adding business content  - data models, semantics and solutions ‚Äì intelligent apps (such as Working Capital, People Intelligence and more to come) to tackle the volatility of todays market. We are doing this in true SaaS manner (‚Äúplug & play‚Äù), so that our customers don‚Äôt have to reinvent the wheel when it comes to data integration, modelling, preserving business rules & semantics from source systems, etc. The platform is fully integrated with our AI services (SAP AI Hub), that will help to introduce new use cases when it comes to supporting the business steering (for example AI agent to provide additional insights about our business performance in the context of overall market performance, AI agent for risk analysis ‚Äì going towards the prescriptive analytics by providing suggestions, etc). We are also enabling advanced AI/ML use cases with SAP Databricks without the replication (delta share/zero copy) - > allowing (near) real time insights and more‚Ä¶

In case you need more support with presenting/selling the SAP BDC offering to your customer(s) please get in touch with our local SAP office to get some additional support (alternatively feel free to send me a message and we can connect you to the right people in your region).

entry.title: Re: ST-PI Version Compatibility Between SAP Solution Mana...
entry.content:
Hello Silvio,

The comment  you refer:

Q14: "Last run of report RTCCTOOL" in EWAlert too old
A14: May occur if the satellite system is on ST-A/PI >=01L but Solution Manager does not yet have the ST-SER 701_2008_2 (both as of December 2008). RTCCTOOL was enhanced as of ST-A/PI 01L to deliver the full recommendations to the EWAlert, but the older Solution Manager release does not yet understand this.
As a workaround run report RTCCTOOL from Tx SE38 and choose Goto->Old RTCCTOOL from the menu. This runs the old tool, which should now also return green status lights for everything that's up to date. The next EWA ( with your current ST-SER) takes this info from the old tool into account.
As a permanent solution, update your Solution Manager to EhP1 (ST 400 SP18, ST-SER 701_2008_2).

It talks about 2008 version which probably referred to SAP Solution Manager 7.0 or 7.1 version. 
There shouldn't be such situation right now, so best practice is to check with RTCCTOOL which is the latest available version to implement on corresponding system. 

Regards,

Luis Salazar

entry.title: Re: I want to display the ‚Äúyear and month‚Äù of the system...
entry.content:
@tsuuuu 

A simple js code in on initialization event of the page can get you that.

Create a script variable of type string called CurrentDate ( can name it as per your choice)

Put the below code in the  on initialization event of the page

var currentDate = new Date(Date.now()); //fetch current date

if(currentDate.getMonth()+1<10) // +1 as js month index at 0
{
	CurrentDate =currentDate.getFullYear().toString()+"/"+ "0"+ (currentDate.getMonth() + 1).toString();
}
	else
		{
			CurrentDate =currentDate.getFullYear().toString()+"/"+ "0"+ (currentDate.getMonth() + 1).toString();
		}

Finally bind the dynamic text with script variable CurrentDate

Output:

 

Hope this helps !!

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Setting up default Variant in ME28
entry.content:
The Scope of List field in ME28 is not variant-sensitive, meaning it doesn't retain the value from your saved variant when you reopen the transaction. Even if you save a variant with "BEST" selected, ME28 will default back to "ALV" unless additional steps are taken.

One option which you can explore is create a Custom Transaction (ZME28) via SE93 with your saved variant of ME28. In the setup, specify the variant where "BEST" is selected. This way, users launch ZME28 and get the desired Scope of List by default. But this is worth only

  • if ME28 is used daily by multiple users, and everyone has to manually switch the Scope of List to "BEST" each time, that‚Äôs a lot of wasted clicks.
  • If users consistently forget to change the Scope of List, leading to incorrect or incomplete release processing.
  • A custom transaction simplifies onboarding‚Äîusers just launch ZME28 and get the correct setup instantly.

The other option is to have an user parameter transaction which can be done via SE93 through which you can create a new tcode ZME28_BEST. Select "Transaction with parameters (parameter transaction)". In the transaction field, set ME28. Set default parameters by adding the following:

  • D_SREPOVARI-REPORT = RM06EF00 (the program behind ME28)
  • D_SREPOVARI-VARIANT = your saved variant name (e.g., BEST_SCOPE)

These parameters ensure ME28 loads with your desired variant.
